title: How Many Calories in Half a Banana?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in half a banana, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in Half a Banana?
assumptions: Medium banana (~118 g whole, peeled); ripe, raw, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by banana size, ripeness, variety, and preparation; values are averages. Check produce labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: Half a medium banana provides ~53 kcal and ~13.5 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp peanut butter per half banana

faqs.q: How many calories is in half a banana?
faqs.a: About 53 kcal for half a medium banana.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in half a banana?
faqs.a: Approximately 13.5 g carbs, including 1.6 g fiber and 7.2 g sugars.
Yes; small bananas have fewer calories (~50 kcal whole), large more (~120 kcal whole).

faqs.q: Are bananas high in protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low in both: half has ~0.7 g protein and 0.2 g fat.

faqs.q: How does ripeness change calories in a banana?
faqs.a: Overripe bananas may have slightly more digestible carbs but similar total calories.
